    • Method Detail

      • setWeaponEffectType

        public void setWeaponEffectType(WeaponEffectType weaponEffectType)
        Set the effect type used. It can be used to know which kind of effect you are handling in order to generate the correct interaction with the user.
        Parameters:
        weaponEffectType - enum that contains the effect type to associate

      • getWeaponEffectType

        public WeaponEffectType getWeaponEffectType()
        Return the effect type of the weapon
        Returns:
        the effect type of the weapon

      • getEnemyList

        public java.util.List<Player> getEnemyList(Player fromPlayer)
        Based on the weapon and it's area of effect of the weapon it retrive all the enemy you can hit with the weapon.
        Parameters:
        fromPlayer - the player who uses the weapon
        Returns:
        a list of Player who are the enemy hittable

      • getPlayerInTheArea

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayerInTheArea(Player fromPlayer,
                                                 AreaOfEffect aoe)
        It calculates all the Player in the area of effect passed as parameter of the player from where it is calculated, its included.
        Parameters:
        fromPlayer - player from where the enemy is visible in the area of effect. It could be differente from the weapon user.
        aoe - enum that indicates the area of effect you are going to see
        Returns:
        a list of Player in the area

      • getMovementList

        public java.util.List<Square> getMovementList(Player player,
                                              Player enemy)
        Parameters:
        player - who used the weapon
        enemy - who could be moved due to the effect
        Returns:
        the list of position the player can move

      • activateEffect

        public void activateEffect(Player player,
                           java.util.List<Player> enemyList)
                    throws EnemySizeLimitExceededException
        It activate the effect of the weapon doing damage and marking the players in the enemyChosenList.
        Parameters:
        player - user player
        enemyList - list of the enemy chosen from the user
        Throws:
        EnemySizeLimitExceededException - whenever the enemy size list is greater than expected

      • checkValidityEnemy

        public boolean checkValidityEnemy(Player weaponUser,
                                  java.util.List<Player> enemyChosenList)
                           throws EnemySizeLimitExceededException
        It assert that the enemy chosen by the user are actually a correct selection.
        Parameters:
        weaponUser - player who used the weapon
        enemyChosenList - list of player chosen by the user to be hitted
        Returns:
        true if the enemy list is good to go, false otherwise
        Throws:
        EnemySizeLimitExceededException - whenever the enemy size list is greater than expected

      • checkValidityMoveEnemy

        public boolean checkValidityMoveEnemy(Square chosenPosition,
                                      Player weaponUser,
                                      java.util.List<Player> enemyList)
                               throws EnemySizeLimitExceededException
        It assert that the movement that the user or the enemy has to do is actually a correct selection.
        Parameters:
        chosenPosition - position where the user/enemy should go
        enemyList - is the enemy hitted by the weapon. It must be one target only
        Returns:
        true if the position is good to go, false otherwise
        Throws:
        EnemySizeLimitExceededException

        the number of target this effect can hit
